intro: Angadenia berteroi, commonly known as the sandstone lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. Angadenia berteroi is also known for its fragrant scent, which attracts pollinators such as bees and moths.
